required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: This purpose of this study is to evaluate the therapeutic efficacy of burst microdosing stimulation paradigms in patients with chronic pain.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a prospective, multicenter, randomized, double-blinded crossover study designed to compare conventional burst stimulation parameters to two different burst microdosing paradigms.
Subjects will be randomized 1:1:1 to one of the three groups. Each group will evaluate all 3 stimulation paradigms in different order.

study_design_info.masking: Double Blind (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment, assessed every 2 weeks for a total of 6 weeks

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment, assessed every 2 weeks for a total of 6 weeks
assessed 6 weeks after baseline at the last follow up visit
secondary_outcome.description: questionnaire to identify preferred stimulation paradigm

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment, assessed every 2 weeks for a total of 6 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: questionnaire on satisfaction with current therapy

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 6 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: monitoring of adverse events occurring during the study

arm_group.description: Stimulations delivered in following order: Standard burst Burst Microdosing 1 Burst Microdosing 2
Stimulations delivered in following order: Burst Microdosing 1 Burst Microdosing 2 Standard burst
Stimulations delivered in following order: Burst Microdosing 2 Standard burst Burst Microdosing 1

intervention.intervention_name: Reprogramming of spinal cord stimulator (Proclaim or Prodigy SJM internal pulse generator) parameters according to study protocol
intervention.description: Stimulation parameters are reprogrammed from original values to study defined ones
